headline: Kinder Morgan Posts Higher Profit, Revenue on Increased Natural Gas Demand

headline: Kinder Morgan Q2 revenue beats estimates; reiterates annual guidance
summary: Investing.com -- Kinder Morgan on Wednesday kept its annual earnings guidance unchanged and pointed to growth in its project pipeline, even as the pipeline operator reported mixed second-quarter results, narrowly beating on revenue but matching earnings estimates.

headline: Kinder Morgan: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Kinder Morgan Inc. KMI) on Wednesday reported second-quarter profit of $715 million. On a per-share basis, the Houston-based company said it had profit of 32 cents.

headline: Kinder Morgan quarterly profit jumps on strong natgas demand
summary: (Reuters) -Kinder Morgan posted a 24% rise in second-quarter profit on Wednesday, as higher volumes of natural gas were transported through its pipelines and demand for the company's infrastructure rose.  Pipeline operators such as Kinder Morgan are benefiting from an increase in demand for natgas, primarily driven by LNG exports as well as rising electricity needs.  The United States was the largest exporter of LNG in 2024, and exports of the superchilled gas are expected to increase even further, as new terminals come online after President Donald Trump lifted a pause on new permits in January.

headline: Earnings, Consumer Sentiment, Retail Sales: What to Watch in the Rest of This Week
summary: Bank of America and Goldman Sachs are among companies reporting results today, as the first big week of this earnings season continues. After Tuesday's consumer-price index, which showed price pressures picking up, data in the days ahead will inclue a readout on wholesale inflation, plus reports on consumer sentiment and retail sales.
